question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Be sure to ensure that the code you generate is executable for demonstration purposes. Please help me implement this SVG image using code. The boxer wore boxing gloves to fight and punch.

checklist.title: Is the boxer character accurately implemented in SVG?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the boxer's body proportions are anatomically correct, with proper stance and posture for a fighting position. Check if the head, torso, arms, and legs are clearly defined using SVG shapes. Score 0 if the boxer is not recognizable, 5 if basic representation is present but proportions are off, and 10 if the boxer looks professionally designed with correct anatomical details.

checklist.title: Are the boxing gloves properly rendered?
checklist.description: Examine if the boxing gloves are visually distinct elements with appropriate size, shape, and positioning on the boxer's hands. They should have the characteristic boxing glove shape with proper padding representation. Deduct 5 points if the gloves look unrealistic or poorly attached to the hands, and 3 points if the gloves lack defining details like wrist straps or shape contours. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the fighting/punching motion implemented?
checklist.description: Check whether the SVG includes animation of punching motions using SVG animation elements (SMIL) or JavaScript. Evaluate the realism of the punch trajectory, timing, and the coordination between arm movement and body weight shift. Give 0 points if no animation is present, 5 points if basic animation exists but looks mechanical, and 10 points if the punching animation is fluid and realistic.

checklist.title: Is the SVG code structured efficiently?
checklist.description: Analyze whether the SVG code uses appropriate grouping (<g> elements), reusable components (symbols or defs), and proper element hierarchy. Check if IDs and classes are used meaningfully. Give 10 points for optimized SVG structure with logical grouping and minimal redundancy, 5 points for basic structure with some organization, and 0 points for unstructured code with no logical grouping.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code handles browser compatibility issues, includes proper viewBox settings for responsiveness, and provides fallbacks for unsupported features. Code with strong robustness should be able to render consistently across major browsers, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if critical compatibility issues exist, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Interactive elements that respond to user clicks 2. Sound effects for punches 3. Opponent reaction to punches 4. Particle effects for impact). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant SVG elements that could be simplified or grouped 2. Unnecessary attributes that don't contribute to the visual output 3. Excessive detail that impacts performance without visual benefit. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core visualization is compromised by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating drawing logic/animation/interaction), code reusability, and maintainability. Deduct 5 points if global variables pollute the namespace; deduct 5 points if the code has high duplication (repeated similar shapes or animations); deduct 5 points if the code lacks comments or clear structure. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the visual design meet professional standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Consistent color palette appropriate for the subject matter 2) Proper proportion and balance in the overall composition 3) Appropriate level of detail for the intended use. Deduct 3 points for each visually jarring element, 5 points for poor color choices, and 5 points for unbalanced composition. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the animation smooth and realistic?
checklist.description: Judge whether the boxing animations conform to physics and human movement: 1) Natural easing for acceleration/deceleration 2) Appropriate timing for punch speed (typically 300-500ms) 3) Secondary motion in the body when throwing punches. Deduct 5 points for each unnatural movement, 3 points for jerky transitions, and 5 points for static elements that should move in response to the action. The full score is 10 points.
